Class MyGraph

java.lang.Object
MyGraph
All Implemented Interfaces:
DynamicGraph, Graph
public class MyGraph extends Object implements DynamicGraph
Adjacency list-like implementation of DynamicGraph. Provides constant-time performance for adding and getting vertices. Removal of a vertex has a O(nlogn) time performance, but it can go as fast as constant time. Basic operations on edges (add, get, remove) have O(logn) time performance and checking if an edge exists is constant-time.

    • exportMatrix

      public double[][] exportMatrix()
      Description copied from interface: DynamicGraph
      Constructs a double matrix with its first row and column showing vertex ids. The value at (0, 0) is always 0.0 and Infinity is used to represent no edge. 
      // Example
MyGraph graph = new MyGraph();
graph.addVertex(new Vertex(54));
graph.addVertex(new Vertex(41));
graph.addEdge(54, 41, 13.5);

// The matrix will be as
// 0.0    54.0        41.0
// 54.0   Infinity    13.5
// 41.0   Infinity    Infinity
      Specified by:
      exportMatrix in interface DynamicGraph
      Returns:
      Adjacency matrix of this graph.
